CalendarTimeUtils > getSecondsPerHour > should calculate exact seconds per hour for extreme calendar (1*1)
CalendarTimeUtils > getDaysPerWeek > should return exact days per week for standard calendar (7 days)
CalendarTimeUtils > getDaysPerWeek > should return exact days per week for non-standard calendar (8 days)
CalendarTimeUtils > getDaysPerWeek > should return exact days per week for extreme calendar (1 day)
CalendarTimeUtils > getMonthsPerYear > should return exact months per year for standard calendar (12 months)
CalendarTimeUtils > getMonthsPerYear > should return exact months per year for non-standard calendar (10 months)
CalendarTimeUtils > getMonthsPerYear > should return exact months per year for extreme calendar (1 month)

testcase.system-out:
=== PF2e Calendar Click Bug Demonstration ===
STEP 1: Initial state Real world creation date: 2025-07-04T12:00:00.000Z Game worldTime: 0 S&S shows (without PF2e integration): 2700/1/1 S&S shows (with PF2e integration): 4725/7/4 PF2e shows: 4725/7/4 Year gap WITHOUT integration: 2025 years Year gap WITH integration: 0 years
=== DEMONSTRATION COMPLETE === The fix ensures S&S uses PF2e worldCreationTimestamp for proper date alignment!

testcase.name: PF2e Calendar Click Bug > identifies the root cause: epoch vs real-time interpretation mismatch
testcase.system-out:
=== Root Cause Analysis === S&S calendar epoch year: 2700 S&S interprets worldTime=0 as year 2700 + calculated days PF2e interprets worldTime=0 as 2025-07-04 (year 4725) Fundamental year gap between systems: 2025 years
ROOT CAUSE: Different worldTime interpretations - S&S: worldTime=0 â†’ epoch-based calendar calculation - PF2e: worldTime=0 â†’ real-world creation date + 0 seconds

testcase.name: PF2e Calendar Click Bug > shows the fix approach: S&S should align with PF2e worldTime interpretation
testcase.system-out:
=== Fix Approach === S&S with PF2e interpretation: 4725/7/4 PF2e native calculation: 4725/7/4
FIX CONFIRMED: S&S aligns with PF2e when using worldCreationTimestamp
